title: Stencil fonts on Simon & Garfunkel album covers (1965 & 2005)
content:
Can someone please help me identify the two stencil fonts used on the titles of Simon & Garfunkel ‘s  
albums “Wednesday Morning 3 AM ” (1965) and “Old Friends Live on Stage”? (2005) I believe you can see them at Amazon .com Thanks, Judith  
 [http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/B00064VQBM/artgarfunkelwebs/103-5803223-7135828](http://web.archive.org/web/20060208041650/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/B00064VQBM/artgarfunkelwebs/103-5803223-7135828)

(Sorry to post in the wrong place. It was my first time.)
author: Judith

comments.content: “Old Friends” uses what looks to be a stenciled version of [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20060208041650/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.120906.0.5&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=SIMON%26GARFUNKEL&sampleSize=29). Could be hand made. I don’t know of a digital version. [Cargo](http://web.archive.org/web/20060208041650/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.109742.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=SIMON%26GARFUNKEL&sampleSize=29) is similar.

[Wednesday](http://web.archive.org/web/20060208041650/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/product/images/B00005NKKW/ref=dp_image_text_0/103-0732683-0493403?%5Fencoding=UTF8&n=5174&s=music) is clearly hand made. Note the differences in the ‘N’s. You might like [Roadworks](http://web.archive.org/web/20060208041650/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=CU.120753.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=WEDNESDAY&sampleSize=48) or [Brassplate](http://web.archive.org/web/20060208041650/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=CU.120739.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=WEDNESDAY&sampleSize=48).

I had thought the same thing - it looks like Helvetica.

Closest stencil font I found (on myfonts) is Arston but it’s not a match.
